channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Locals weigh in on Trump's move to crack down on crime in D.C.
item.description: Crime in D.C. is at a 30-year low, according to the DOJ. But violent crime persists in some neighborhoods. How much of a law enforcement presence is there now amid Trump's crackdown?

item.title: 'Lion King' puppet designer helps put a spin on a classic in 'Romeo and Zooliet'
item.description: Romeo and Juliet is one of Shakespeare's most famous plays. A Shakespeare festival in St. Louis has found a way to make kid friendly as well with the help of a famous puppet designer.

item.title: Trump isn't the first U.S. president to seek to strengthen ties with Putin
item.description: President Trump will meet Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss an end to Russia's war in Ukraine. Trump has long said that his relationship with Putin will help him strike a deal.

item.title: How much money is Trump making off of the presidency?
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with the David Kirkpatrick of The New Yorker about his investigation into how much the Trump family has profited from both presidencies.

item.title: A summer camp aims to close the AI know-how gap for low-income high schoolers
item.description: A free camp for low-income high schoolers aims to close the digital divide around AI know-how. Campers work on AI solutions to real-world environmental and medical challenges.

item.title: How drones have become essential for both sides in the Russia-Ukraine war
item.description: Presidents Trump and Putin will be landing to discuss a possible end to Russia's war in Ukraine. A war that — at the moment — is not letting up. In fact, it's seen in increase in drone warfare.

item.title: Alaskans react to Putin's visit
item.description: Alaska has a long relationship with Russia -- both positive and negative. In advance of Trump and Putin's meeting in Anchorage, we get reactions from Alaskans about the summit in their state.

item.title: A look at how the Trump administration is changing America's focus on human rights
item.description: Activists and former officials are alarmed by the way the Trump administration is changing the way the U.S. promotes human rights around the world.

item.title: New book looks back at 'Sunset Boulevard,' a poison-dipped love letter to Hollywood
item.description: David M. Lubin's book Ready for My Close-Up: The Making of Sunset Boulevard and the Dark Side of the Hollywood Dream looks at how the film's poison-dipped love letter to Hollywood endures 75 years later.

item.title: Bad Bunny comes home
item.description: Bad Bunny's 30-concert residency in Puerto Rico this summer has become an immense source of local pride unlike any cultural event in the island's modern history.
